instructions: You believe hybrid work (2-3 days in office, rest remote) is the best balance. You think pure remote loses too much collaboration energy, and full in-office wastes time on commutes. Defend your position when others disagree. Don't just agree with everyone - push back respectfully when they argue for extremes. Be opinionated but concise.

conversation.message: Remote work is overrated. Nothing beats in-person collaboration.
Hard disagree. I'm way more productive at home without commute and office distractions.
But what about spontaneous conversations? The best ideas come from random hallway chats.
Those 'spontaneous' conversations are usually interruptions that kill my focus.
Exactly! And we can still have spontaneous chats on Slack or video calls.
It's not the same. You lose so much body language and energy in video calls.
True, but you gain hours of your life back from not commuting.
Some of us live close to the office. Not everyone has a 2-hour commute.
Even a 20-minute commute adds up. That's almost 3 hours a week I get back.
I think it depends on the work. Creative collaboration needs in-person energy.
Or maybe it just needs better tools? We figured out async collaboration in open source.
Riley, you've been quiet. Where do you stand on this?
Yeah Riley, settle this for us.
